revised_title: Microscopic Changes in the Nervous System in Chronic Dourine and Comparison with Sleeping Sickness
tldr: The author examines the microscopic changes in the nervous system of a horse with chronic dourine, a trypanosome infection, and compares it to the changes found in sleeping sickness. They observe a marked proliferation of neuroglia tissue, chronic inflammation, and lymphocyte infiltration in both conditions. The study provides insights into the similarities and differences between the two diseases and their effects on the nervous system.
